title: ldap
name: ldap
description:
Provides an interface to LDAP Lightweight Directory Access Protocol
  directory servers like the Netscape Directory Server.

attributes.name: returnAsBinary
attributes.description: A comma-delimited list of columns that are to be returned as binary values.

attributes.name: server
attributes.description: Host name "biff.upperlip.com" or IP address "192.1.2.225" of the LDAP server.

attributes.name: port
attributes.description: Port defaults to the standard LDAP port, 389.

attributes.name: username
attributes.description: If no user name is specified, the LDAP connection is anonymous.

attributes.name: secure
attributes.description: The type of security to use

attributes.name: password
attributes.description: used when username is defined

attributes.name: action
attributes.description: Specifies the LDAP action.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: The name you assign to the LDAP query.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description:
Specifies the maximum amount of time, in seconds, to wait for LDAP processing. Defaults to
		60 seconds.

attributes.name: maxRows
attributes.description: Specifies the maximum number of entries for LDAP queries.

attributes.name: start
attributes.description: Specifies the distinguished name of the entry to be used to start the search.

attributes.name: scope
attributes.description:
Specifies the scope of the search from the entry specified in the Start attribute
		for action = "Query".

attributes.name: attributes
attributes.description:
Required if action = "Query", "Add", "ModifyDN", or "Modify"
            For queries: comma-delimited list of attributes to return. For
            queries, to get all attributes, specify "*".

            If action = "add" or "modify", you can specify a list of update
            columns. Separate attributes with a semicolon.

            If action = "ModifyDN", CFML passes attributes to the
            LDAP server without syntax checking.

attributes.name: filter
attributes.description:
Search criteria for action = "Query".
            List attributes in the form:
            "(attribute operator value)" Example: "(sn = Smith)"

attributes.name: filterFile
attributes.description: this attribute is deprecated and no longer supported.

attributes.name: sort
attributes.description: Indicates the attribute or attributes by which to sort query results. Use a comma to separate attributes.

attributes.name: sortControl
attributes.description: Specifies how to sort query results.

attributes.name: dn
attributes.description: Specifies the distinguished name for update actions.

attributes.name: startRow
attributes.description:
Used in conjunction with action = "Query". Specifies the first row of the LDAP query to insert
		into the query. The default is 1.

attributes.name: modifyType
attributes.description: Indicates whether to add, delete, or replace an attribute in a multi-value list of attributes.

attributes.name: rebind
attributes.description:
If you set rebind to Yes, cfldap attempts to rebind the referral callback and reissue the query
		by the referred address using the original credentials. The default is No, which means referred
		connections are anonymous.

attributes.name: referral
attributes.description: Number of hops allowed in a referral. A value of 0 disables referred addresses for LDAP; no data is returned.

attributes.name: separator
attributes.description:
Specifies the character that cfldap uses to separate attribute values in multi-value attributes. This character is used by the query, add, and modify action attributes, and
		by cfldap to output multi-value attributes. The default character is the comma (,).

attributes.name: delimiter
attributes.description:
Specifies the character that cfldap uses to separate multiple attribute name/value pairs when more than one attribute is specified in the attribute attribute or the attribute that you want to use has the default delimiter character, which is the semicolon (;), such as mgrpmsgrejecttext;lang-en. The delimiter character is used by the query, add, and
		modify action attributes, and is used by cfldap to output multi-value attributes
